page.title: 16Village School Slitting Mill
page.content: Stonehouse Primary school opened in 1892, but it will miss its centenary by seven years because it is closing down in July 1985. There are only 19 pupils now. The school once had 90 pupils. There are two teachers and two classes. As the school is very small it is much quieter than a large school. The pupils who were interviewed said that one of the advantages of such a small school was that they still had a big playground, with games lines painted on. House points are given for good work, so the pupils try to get an "Excellent" which is worth 2 points or a "Good" worth 1 point.
